docs.snippet: NEWPORT, R.I., Sept. 11 -- The schooner Benjamin A. Van Brunt from New-Jersey, with 1,328 tons of coal for Fall River. was run down and sunk near the latter port this morning, having first been struck by the steamer Pilgrim and then by the Provide...
docs.abstract: Providence; Benjamin A. Van Brunt Sunk
docs.lead_paragraph: NEWPORT, R.I., Sept. 11 -- The schooner Benjamin A. Van Brunt from New-Jersey, with 1,328 tons of coal for Fall River. was run down and sunk near the latter port this morning, having first been struck by the steamer Pilgrim and then by the Providence. Capt. Davis of the Pilgrim says, when within four minutes of his dock, going into Fall River this morning, he sighted a schooner directly in the channel.

headline.main: A COAL SCHOONER SUNK.; THE BENJAMIN A. VAN BRUNT CUT DOWN BY THE STEAMER PROVIDENCE.

docs.snippet: FATHER POINT, Quebec, Nov. 12. -- Capt. Lindall, commander, and a quartermaster of the steamer Vancouver, which passed inward this morning from Liverpool, were washed overboard and drowned on Friday morning last. The steamship Vancouver left Liver...
docs.lead_paragraph: FATHER POINT, Quebec, Nov. 12. -- Capt. Lindall, commander, and a quartermaster of the steamer Vancouver, which passed inward this morning from Liverpool, were washed overboard and drowned on Friday morning last. The steamship Vancouver left Liverpool with heavy sea running and a head wind. The wind increased until it developed into hurricane force and caused the ship's speed to average only about seven knots an hour instead of fifteen, her usual speed.

headline.main: SWEPT OVERBOARD AND DROWNED.; CAPT. LINDALL OF THE STEAMER VANCOUVER ONE OF THE VICTIMS.

docs.snippet: The steamship Teutonic was made fast at the White Star Line's dock yesterday morning more than twelve hours after the arrival of her competitor in the race for rapid-passage honors -- the Inman Line steamship City of New-York. The lack of knowledg...
docs.abstract: Teutonic Beaten by City of New-York; Fire from Electric Light
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Teutonic was made fast at the White Star Line's dock yesterday morning more than twelve hours after the arrival of her competitor in the race for rapid-passage honors -- the Inman Line steamship City of New-York. The lack of knowledge on the part of her officers as to any attempt to reach this port ahead of the City of New-York was surprising.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE TEUTONIC.; A LITTLE ELECTRICAL DISPLAY -- THE SHIP'S PASSENGERS.
A STEAMER ON AN ICEBERG.; NARROW ESCAPE OF THE PORTIA ON HER WAY FROM PILLEY'S ISLAND.
IT IS PRESIDENT HUNT NOW.; J.E. SIMMONS RESIGNS FROM THE BOARD OF EDUCATIONS.

docs.snippet: Word was received at the offices of the Staten Island Rapid Transit Company yesterday of the burning at sea of the transfer boat Groton, which was being sent by them to Baltimore....

headline.main: A VESSEL BURNED AT SEA.; THE GROTON DESTROYED OFF THE MARYLAND COAST.

docs.snippet: The Hamburg American steamships Gellert and Italic, which were reported by the Scale as on their way to this port, the Italia, in tow of the Gellert, arrived early yesterday forenoon. They had performed a remarkably difficult feat in very good tim...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Hamburg American steamships Gellert and Italic, which were reported by the Scale as on their way to this port, the Italia, in tow of the Gellert, arrived early yesterday forenoon. They had performed a remarkably difficult feat in very good time.

headline.main: WHY THE ITALIA'S DELAY; THE PROPELLER SHAFT BROKE IN MIDOCEAN.

docs.snippet: The steamer Vertumnus, Capt. Thompson, from Jamaica with a cargo of fruit, went ashore on a newly-formed sand bar opposite Point Lookout Live-Saving Station, near Long Beach, L.I., about 8 o'clock on Monday night....
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Vertumnus, Capt. Thompson, from Jamaica with a cargo of fruit, went ashore on a newly-formed sand bar opposite Point Lookout Live-Saving Station, near Long Beach, L.I., about 8 o'clock on Monday night.

headline.main: THE VERTUMNUS ASHORE.; A FRUIT STEAMER STRIKES A BAR NEAR POINT LOOKOUT.

docs.snippet: The ship Anahuac of Boston, Capt. Whelden, arrived here yesterday after an unusually exciting and dangerous voyage of 133 days from Colombo. Capt. Whelden reports that after leaving Ceylon he had a succession of heavy head seas and winds and was h...
docs.lead_paragraph: The ship Anahuac of Boston, Capt. Whelden, arrived here yesterday after an unusually exciting and dangerous voyage of 133 days from Colombo. Capt. Whelden reports that after leaving Ceylon he had a succession of heavy head seas and winds and was handled very roughly.

headline.main: A MYSTERIOUS LEAK.; PRECARIOUS VOYAGE OF THE SHIP ANAHUAC OF BOSTON.

docs.snippet: The tug Burgess, sunk recently in the East River by collision with the ferryboat Brooklyn, was yesterday placed on the marine railway at Red Hook. The tug was raised by the derrick lighter Will, owned by Chapman  Co. of this city....
docs.lead_paragraph: The tug Burgess, sunk recently in the East River by collision with the ferryboat Brooklyn, was yesterday placed on the marine railway at Red Hook. The tug was raised by the derrick lighter Will, owned by Chapman Co. of this city.
